Description: Small fragment of a seal-impression, the fine brown Nile clay has some mica inclusions and was hardened after excavation. The rear shows a slightly convex rounded area like from a bag or suchlike (similar to EA86732, EA86756, EA86759 and EA86762) with textile impressions. In the break a turned string with a width of 0.3 cm. The top shows a clear and deep oval scarab-like seal-impression with a lot finger impressions next to it. The motif shows a circumferential line with two standing figures facing each other, on the right Ptah in mummy shape with beard and a wAs-sceptre in front of him. On the left another figure, wearing a long kilt, both arms in gesture of adoration, the head is broken off.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E14.7 temple magazine
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
